text:
Ant needs a namespace-aware version of DynamicConfigurator.

The methods should have access to namespace URI, local name and namespace prefix.
In addition I'd like to see the element and attributes names passed to the methods
without changing their case.  This would make XMLFragment more useful.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
peter.reilly@corvil.com

Created attachment 11307
Patch file for namespace aware dynamic configurator

creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com
text:
I have placed a patch for this.
One small shortcomming is the treatment of attributes:
<x:tag x:attr="value" y:attr="value2"/>

will be stored internally as:
<x:tag attr="value" y:attr="value2"/>

I had time to look through your patch yesterday - I start to get used to eight
hour train rides 8-)

Apart from some minor things (I wouldn't use "else if" in setAttribute since a
class may elect to implement both interfaces) I'm fine with the patch.  Of course,
XMLFragment should call Node.setPrefix to be useful.

Thanks!
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text:
The "else if" was on purpose.
There should be only one callback per attribute.
For example if macroinstance used DynamicConfiguratorNs
as well as DynamicConfigurator (for bc purposes), it
could capture the calls to setAttribute (no ns) for
objects that call macroinstance (<for> for example),
and call setAttribute (with ns).

As regards the prefix, you are correct.
The call to Element#setAttributeNS() takes
a qualified name and not a local name (unlike
Element#getAttruibuteNS() which takes a local name),
also Document#createElementNS() takes a qualified
name.

I will update the XMLFragment code and commit.
